page.title: 16HOW HARTHILL HAS CHANGED
page.content: At first Harthill was just the church, chapel, school and a few houses.But then the miners moved in and Firvale and Winney Hill were built.Just after the Second World War some new houses were built at Pryor Mede,Doctor Lane,and near the ponds.Then an old farmhouse called South Farm was built around, with a play area at the back. Later the Northlands estate was built near the church on the "Glebe lands". Soon a play area was built next to the Blue Bell on Woodall Lane. A lot of work has been going on at the ponds: a new bridge has been built to join the second pond to the first. Our school has been changed recently: our hall has been enlarged, and we now have two classrooms in the main building and four across the yard.
